State Highway 36 to fully close for two weeks for slip repairs https://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/news/state-highway-36-to-complete-close-for-two-weeks-for-slip-repairs/WUF5OQES4FBENFEFLEVXLIJUN4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/news/state-highway-36-to-complete-close-for-two-weeks-for-slip-repairs/WUF5OQES4FBENFEFLEVXLIJUN4/ SH36, between Rotorua and Tauranga, will be closed for about two weeks for slip repairs. Whanganui’s future sports champions receive helping hand from community https://www.nzherald.co.nz/whanganui-chronicle/news/whanganuis-future-sports-champions-receive-helping-hand-from-community/7WYEFHA5I5CXXMUQPELMDAM7YA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/whanganui-chronicle/news/whanganuis-future-sports-champions-receive-helping-hand-from-community/7WYEFHA5I5CXXMUQPELMDAM7YA/ The Future Champions Trust helps young sportspeople going to international competitions. Thu, 25 Jul 2024 00:21:56 +0000 The latest Future Champions Trust recipients at a presentation with trustees and sponsors (back row, from left) trustees Stuart Kelly, Ron Cheatley, Tania King; recipient Lucas Munn; sponsor Hayden Gibson; recipients Jake Newton and William Herd; (front row) trustee Philippa Baker-Hogan; recipients Jayde Bell, Symone Belton, Michaela Ross; sponsor Sarah Gibson; Merekānara Ponga (representing recipient Ngarongokaumoana Ponga who is overseas).
